body:
You have a really old version.

You'd want to update and re-test.

@Animosity022 Same behaviour with `rclone` v1.66.0 on another system : 
```shell
 $ rclone version
rclone v1.66.0
- os/version: ubuntu 22.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.15.0-58-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.22.1
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
$ rclone -vv --low-level-retries 1 ls myNAS-SMB:
2024/04/25 12:05:16 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.66.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "-vv" "--low-level-retries" "1" "ls" "myNAS-SMB:"]
2024/04/25 12:05:16 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "myNAS-SMB:"
2024/04/25 12:05:16 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/administrateur/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2024/04/25 12:05:17 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error couldn't connect SMB: response error: The attempted logon is invalid. This is either due to a bad username or authentication information.)
2024/04/25 12:05:17 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 200ms
2024/04/25 12:05:17 ERROR : : error listing: couldn't connect SMB: response error: The attempted logon is invalid. This is either due to a bad username or authentication information.
2024/04/25 12:05:17 DEBUG : 6 go routines active
2024/04/25 12:05:17 Failed to ls with 2 errors: last error was: couldn't connect SMB: response error: The attempted logon is invalid. This is either due to a bad username or authentication information.
$
```

I can reproduce on v1.68.2.

Fixed in the latest release of https://github.com/CloudSoda/go-smb2

issue.title: Update go-smb2

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

The latest release supports Kerberos: https://github.com/CloudSoda/go-smb2/pull/24

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

#7800

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Thanks to @frafra for updating go-smb2 - this should be fixed now in 1c74b994bbf612c66ec2e49d273ad981ad85da64

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.69

@ncw So I can conclude `rclone` is using `go-smb2` for smb access, right ?

`rclone version` do not show the version of `go-smb2` that `rclone` is using, how can I show what version of `go-smb2` that `rclone` is using ?

>  So I can conclude `rclone` is using `go-smb2` for smb access, right ?

Yes

> `rclone version` do not show the version of `go-smb2` that `rclone` is using, how can I show what version of `go-smb2` that `rclone` is using ?

Check the go.mod file is the easiest way

> > So I can conclude `rclone` is using `go-smb2` for smb access, right ?
> 
> Yes
> 
> > `rclone version` do not show the version of `go-smb2` that `rclone` is using, how can I show what version of `go-smb2` that `rclone` is using ?
> 
> Check the go.mod file is the easiest way

My last question was about the rclone I installed on my system, there is no `go.mod` on my system : 
```shell
$ rclone version
rclone v1.68.2
- os/version: ubuntu 22.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.15.0-78-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.23.3
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
$ dpkg -L rclone | grep go.mod
$
```

Hi there, I'm the author of the [go-smb2 kerberos PR](https://github.com/CloudSoda/go-smb2/pull/24). Updating to the latest version of the library is not enough, some changes need to be made to the `smb` backend. I have a PR almost ready for that â€“ I just need to update the integration tests and then I'll submit it!

Thanks @jgiannuzzi I didn't realise that. I'll reopen this issue then

@sebma you find the libraries a go binary uses with the go tools (you'll need to install go)

    go version -m rclone 

Maybe I should get rclone to do that itself...

> `go version -m rclone `

@ncw Hi, this command does not work on my system, it says : 
```shell
$ go version -m rclone
stat rclone: no such file or directory
$
```

issue.title: support for SMB?

repository.name: motuz
repository.description: Motuz - A web based infrastructure for large scale data movements between on-premise and cloud

issue.body:
rclone does not support smb (SAMBA) yet but if it does it would be really helpful if Motuz supported it.

We have use cases where people need to move data using SMB.

I just filed this issue so that we can track the SMB issue in the rclone repos:

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/2042

issue.title: smb: add support for kerberos authentication

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Describe the changes here
-->

Add support for kerberos authentication to the `smb` backend.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

Fixes #7800.
